files.description: Module for reading the Quran text from a file. Contains a function to open a file and return its contents, or raise an IOError if the file cannot be read.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The path to the Quran text file.

files.description: This module provides functionality for preprocessing and normalizing Arabic text. It includes functions to remove diacritics and normalize specific Arabic letters according to certain rules. The module is designed to standardize Arabic text for further processing in NLP or text analysis applications.

functions.name: remove_diacritics
functions.description: Removes all Arabic diacritical marks (tashkeel) from the input text. These marks include fatha, kasra, damma, sukun, shadda, and other vowel marks that appear above or below letters in Arabic script. The function uses regular expressions to identify and remove these marks.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The original Arabic text containing diacritics that need to be removed.

functions.name: normalize_arabic_letters
functions.description: Normalizes specific Arabic letters in the given text according to contextual rules. It specifically handles two cases: 1) Converting the Arabic letter 'ى' (alef maqsura, U+0649) to 'ي' (yeh, U+064A) only when it appears as a standalone word, and 2) Converting the Arabic letter 'ة' (teh marbuta, U+0629) to 'ه' (heh, U+0647) when it appears at the end of words. This normalization helps standardize text variations that are semantically equivalent in Arabic.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The Arabic text to be normalized.

files.description: Module for analyzing the Quran text for hidden patterns and anomalies. Contains various functions for text analysis including analyze_text, analyze_word_frequency, analyze_root_words, analyze_bigrams, and analyze_verse_repetitions. It imports standard libraries and project modules (src/logger.py and src/text_preprocessor.py) for logging and text preprocessing.

functions.name: analyze_text
functions.description: Analyze the given text for hidden numerical patterns and anomalies. Simulates pattern detection by appending a calculated numerical pattern if the text is non-empty.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The preprocessed text of the Quran.

functions.name: analyze_word_frequency
functions.description: Perform word frequency analysis. Tokenizes the text, counts word occurrences, composes a summary of top words, and flags words with non-typical frequencies based on a heuristic. Returns a formatted summary and a list of flagged messages.

functions.name: analyze_root_words
functions.description: Perform Arabic root word analysis on the given Quran text. Uses CAMeL Tools analyzer if available; otherwise falls back to a token-based approach. Returns a summary of the analysis, a dictionary of root frequencies, and the top N most frequent roots.

functions.name: analyze_bigrams
functions.description: Perform bigram (or n-gram) frequency analysis on the tokenized text. Generates n-grams from the token list and returns their frequency counts in a dictionary.

parameters.name: tokenized_text
parameters.description: A list of preprocessed tokens from the Quran text.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of words in each n-gram (default is 2 for bigrams).

functions.name: analyze_verse_repetitions
functions.description: Analyze verse repetitions within each Surah and across the entire Quran. Normalizes verses and returns analysis including repetitions within surahs and across the Quran in a structured dictionary.

parameters.name: preprocessed_text
parameters.description: The preprocessed Quran text where each line represents a verse.

files.description: Module for logging analysis outputs of the Quran Secrets application. Provides functions to log secret findings, results, and bigram frequencies into a log file with timestamps.

functions.name: log_secret_found
functions.description: Logs a secret finding to the results.log file with a special tag and a timestamp.

functions.name: log_result
functions.description: Logs a result message to the results.log file with a timestamp.

functions.name: log_bigram_frequencies
functions.description: Logs the top N most frequent bigrams to the results log file including header and frequency counts for the top N bigrams.

parameters.name: bigram_frequencies
parameters.description: A dictionary mapping bigram tuples to frequency counts.

parameters.name: top_n
parameters.description: The number of top bigrams to log (default is 20).

files.description: This file contains integration tests for the main module of the application. It tests the end-to-end execution of the main function with two scenarios: one where CAMeL Tools is not available (fallback mode) and another where CAMeL Tools is available. The tests verify that the application correctly processes Arabic text, performs various analyses (word frequency, root word analysis, bigram analysis, verse repetition), and logs the results appropriately. The file includes mocking of external dependencies to simulate different environments.

classes.name: TestMainIntegration
classes.description: A test class that contains integration tests for the main module. It verifies the end-to-end functionality of the application in different scenarios.

methods.name: setUp
methods.description: Sets up the test environment before each test method is executed. Configures maxDiff to None to see full diff output in case of test failures.

methods.name: test_main_integration_fallback
methods.description: Tests the full execution of the main() function when CAMeL Tools is not available. It creates a sample Quran text file, mocks the absence of CAMeL Tools, runs the main function, and verifies that the expected analysis results are present in the log file.

methods.name: test_main_integration_with_camel_tools
methods.description: Tests the full execution of the main() function when CAMeL Tools is available. It creates a sample Quran text file, mocks the presence of CAMeL Tools and its analyzer functionality, runs the main function, and verifies that the expected analysis results (including root word analysis using CAMeL Tools) are present in the log file. The mock analyzer is configured to return 'حمد' as the root for the token 'الحمد' (after diacritics removal from 'الْحَمْدُ').
